knimeNode.name: Star
knimeNode.shortDescription: STAR aligns RNA-seq reads to a reference genome using uncompressed suffix arrays and is "splice aware".

fullDescription.intro:
STAR, a "splice aware" RNA-seq aligner, aligns RNA-seq reads to a reference genome using uncompressed suffix arrays.
For details, please see paper:
Dobin et al, Bioinformatics 2012; doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/bts635
STAR: ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner
Options were tested with alpha 2.3.1z but should work also with different versions because of the parameterFile option.

tab.name: level 0 and 1 options
tab.option: Path to the compiled STAR binary. Theoretically all versions starting from alpha 2.3.1z should be supported.

Can be used to set parameters which can not be set directly in this node.
Expected syntax: parameterName (with '-' or '--') parameterValue(s)
Example: --runThreadN 4
Supported parameters can be looked up in the parametersDefault file which is shipped together with the STAR source files.
Parameters can be set like you would normally use them on the command line for this binary. This parameters override the settings in the parameter file and are overridden by the settings of level 2.

tab.name: level 2 options
tab.option:
alignReads or generateGenome:
alignReads: aligns reads to a reference genome
generateGenome: generates a genome index out of one or more fasta files
Path to the genome which was indexed by STAR using the "generate genome mode". This option is only needed in the "align read mode".
Path where all the output data is stored.

ports.inPort:
Input depends on the runMode:
-alignReads: Input from RunAligner node (single- and paired-reads are supported)
-generateGenome: Input from FastaSelector node (list of fasta files)
ports.outPort:
Cell 0: runMode (alignReads or generateGenome)
Cell 1: path to output folder
Cell 2: path to parameter file if one was used

views.view: Shows the STDOUT and STDERR output of STAR when it was executed successfully.
